data.title: Juan Carlos Acuna Gerard - Men's Tennis
data.meta_description: Juan Carlos Acuna Gerard - Senior (2012-2013): Went 6-11 in the spring...Went 0-3 in the Bulls' no. 3 spot, 1-3 in the 4, 3-4 in th 5th position and 1-1 as 6.. Went
data.text:
Senior (2012-2013): Went 6-11 in the spring...Went 0-3 in the Bulls' no. 3 spot, 1-3 in the 4, 3-4 in th 5th position and 1-1 as 6.. Went 5-8 in doubles play with a mixture of Federico Sabogal and Everth Dzib...Competed in two fall tournaments for the Bulls...He completed the season with a 2-2 record.

Junior (2011-12) - Competed in 24 dual meets for the Bulls compiling a 11-12 singles record...Compiled a 6-5 singles record during the fall schedule...Earned a win at the ITA Regionals in Athens, Ga. against FAMU's Chidi Gabriel...Teamed up with Sebastian Hagn in doubles and together went 1-3 during the fall.

Sophomore (2010-11) - Compiled an 11-5 dual match record and an 18-12 overall record ... Played primarily at No. 5 or No. 6, with one match in the No. 4 position ... Earned wins that helped the Bulls to victories over ranked opponents VCU, DePaul, Texas A&M - Corpus Christi and Iowa.

Freshman (2009-10) - Went 6-6 in dual matches and 14-11 overall while competing primarily in the No. 5 and No. 6 singles positions...Helped lead the Bulls to a 4-2 victory over St. John's in the quarterfinals of the BIG EAST Championships with his 6-4, 6-4 singles victory over Martin Kosut... Teamed up with sophomore Mark Oljaca in the No. 3 doubles position and together went 2-3 in dual matches.

Highschool/Juinors: Graduated from the Thomas Jefferson Institute in Mexico...Gerard joins the Bulls after having won seven national singles championships and six doubles national championships...Gerard was also ranked No. 1 in Mexico in 2007 and 2008 in the U-18 rankings...In 2008 Gerard gathered his first ATP points and received a bronze medal in the Central American and Caribbean Olympic Games.
